ygData.subject: Controlling overrides from the command line
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, How do I control overrides from the command line? I am able to control Heritrix and the running job from the command line using: java -jar

Subject: Controlling overrides from the command line

Hello,

How do I control overrides from the command line?


I am able to control Heritrix and the running job from the command line
using:

java -jar cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar controlRole:password
localhost:8849
org.archive.crawler:host=host,jmxport=8849,mother=Heritrix,name=ABCD-20090514100707694,type=CrawlService.Job


If I want to know the current courtesy pause set I just use the command

java -jar cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar controlRole:password
localhost:8849
org.archive.crawler:host=host,jmxport=8849,mother=Heritrix,name=ABCD-20090514100707694,type=CrawlService.Job 

/crawl-order/frontier/min-delay-ms

which outputs

05/14/2009 14:44:24 +0100 org.archive.jmx.Client
/crawl-order/frontier/min-delay-ms: 2000


If I want to set a new value for it, I use

java -jar cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar controlRole:password
localhost:8849
org.archive.crawler:host=host,jmxport=8849,mother=Heritrix,name=ABCD-20090514100707694,type=CrawlService.Job 

/crawl-order/frontier/min-delay-ms=10000


I can change the settings for overrides using the Web interface but how 
do I change this value (or any other setting) for an override using the 
command line? How do I specify that the setting I want to change is only 
for the override and not for the main definitions of the job?


Thank you very much.

-- 
/Jo�o Miranda
